Provides a VPC DHCP Options resource.
## Remarks

* Notice that all arguments are optional but you have to specify at least one argument.
* `domain_name_servers`, `netbios_name_servers`, `ntp_servers` are limited by AWS to maximum four servers only.
* To actually use the DHCP Options Set you need to associate it to a VPC using `aws.ec2.VpcDhcpOptionsAssociation`.
* If you delete a DHCP Options Set, all VPCs using it will be associated to AWS's `default` DHCP Option Set.
* In most cases unless you're configuring your own DNS you'll want to set `domain_name_servers` to `AmazonProvidedDNS`.

import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        var foo = new VpcDhcpOptions("foo", VpcDhcpOptionsArgs.builder()        
            .domainName("service.consul")
            .domainNameServers(            
                "127.0.0.1",
                "10.0.0.2")

            .netbiosNodeType(2)
            .ntpServers("127.0.0.1")

}

## VpcDhcpOptions Resource Properties {#properties}

To learn more about resource properties and how to use them, see [Inputs and Outputs](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) in the Architecture and Concepts docs.

### Inputs

The VpcDhcpOptions resource accepts the following [input](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) properties:



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="domainname_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#domainname_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Domain<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>the suffix domain name to use by default when resolving non Fully Qualified Domain Names. In other words, this is what ends up being the <code>search</code> value in the <code>/etc/resolv.conf</code> file.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="domainnameservers_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#domainnameservers_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Domain<wbr>Name<wbr>Servers</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of name servers to configure in <code>/etc/resolv.conf</code>. If you want to use the default AWS nameservers you should set this to <code>AmazonProvidedDNS</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="netbiosnameservers_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#netbiosnameservers_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Netbios<wbr>Name<wbr>Servers</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of NETBIOS name servers.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="netbiosnodetype_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#netbiosnodetype_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Netbios<wbr>Node<wbr>Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The NetBIOS node type (1, 2, 4, or 8). AWS recommends to specify 2 since broadcast and multicast are not supported in their network. For more information about these node types, see <a href="http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2132.txt">RFC 2132</a>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ntpservers_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ntpservers_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Ntp<wbr>Servers</a>
</span>

        <span id="state_netbiosnameservers_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of NETBIOS name servers.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_netbiosnodetype_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The NetBIOS node type (1, 2, 4, or 8). AWS recommends to specify 2 since broadcast and multicast are not supported in their network. For more information about these node types, see <a href="http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2132.txt">RFC 2132</a>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_ntpservers_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of NTP servers to configure.</p>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_ownerid_go">

    </dt>
    <dd><p>The ID of the AWS account that owns the DHCP options set.</p>

            title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">map[string]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>

            title="Optional, Deprecated">
        <span id="state_tagsall_go">

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import VPC DHCP Options using the DHCP Options `id`. For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:ec2/vpcDhcpOptions:VpcDhcpOptions my_options dopt-d9070ebb
```

<dl class="package-details">
	<dt>Repository</dt>
	<dd><a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aws">AWS Classic pulumi/pulumi-aws</a></dd>
	<dt>License</dt>
